Posts.Content: Does anyone know if she had a mastectomy or chemo
Posts.Title: Elizabeth Edwards

Posts.Content: Thanks so much thats what I thought too but wasn't sure.  Sadly I think it might have been more of a sucess if she went for the mastectomy but no one can choose for you.
Posts.Title: Elizabeth Edwards

Posts.Content: Yes sadly her cancer has spread to her bones.  I was wondering because I had the same kind of breast cancer but did have a mastectomy and chemo.
Posts.Title: Elizabeth Edwards

Posts.Content: Hi there, I am new to this and wanted to share my story with 2.5 years on Tamoxafin.  I just had a hysterectomy and was switched to Aromasin.  I took it for 4 months and had experienced joint/ bone and tingeling pain in my arms and hands.  I am now  on femora for the first time tonight.  I hope it works better with less side effects.  I also was given pain med to take as needed.  Its hard to be on these drugs and as I read for some I agree that its worse at night and if our days are busy enough its not that noticeable. Good luck to all my pink sisters.  Jan
Posts.Title: Aromasin after five years?

Posts.Content: Kim, I was on Aromasin and Femora both are Aroma inhibitors.  I didn't do well on Aromasin and was on it for 4 months.  I had all the classic side effects you might have read about..... bone pain, head aches hand and arm numbness and pain and mostly just feeling old and I am 45.  I had simular effects on Femora which I was on for 2 weeks.  I asked my oncologist to return my treatment to Tamoxafin for the remander of my 2plus years on drug therapy. So far I am feeling much better.  I hope that you do better but if you don't don't wait to long to switch to something else its quality of life remember!!!!!!!!!!  Good luck sister.  Jan
Posts.Title: side effects arimdex

Posts.Content: Hi there I was on aromosin too for just four months,  I had all the soreness that you have discribed and head aches too.  I am now trying femora and hope that things will get easier.  Its too soon to tell.  If femora is a bust like aromasin I will also ask to return to tamoxafin.  Thanks for sharing your experiences.  Jan
Posts.Title: Should I keep taking Aromosin?

Posts.Content: hi there, yes I was on Tamoxafinfor 2.5 years had a hysterectomy  as a preventative so then I was put on Aromasin.  I had headaches arm aches and numbness in my hands as well.  I switched to Famora and nothing changed.  I stayed on it just one week and asked my oncologist to just put me back on Tamoxafin.  Since then almost 2 weeks now I am feeling much better.  My bone pain is slowly going away.  I would rather have the last 2 years of my pill therapy go easier than feel like a 90 year old at 45.  I hope that my story helps you feel better for returning to Tamoxafin.
Posts.Title: back to Tamoxifen
